ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1.5 hours per week
2 hours
30 minutes
0 except for paper which was about 4-5
2 hours at the end of the term to write the paper

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great speakers; appreciate the diversity of speakers
Stellar. I love this class.
Great opportunity to hear healthcare leaders talk openly about their career trajectory, accomplishments, and failures.
Learned a lot, oved the structure of the class.

Loved this class - great opportunity to hear from current people in the field. Mainly focused on hospital administration, though a few others sprinkled through in policy roles and more social justice related roles. Highly recommend!

Definitely a highlight of my MPH education! I really enjoyed hearing about the different life experiences of different leaders in healthcare. I learned a lot from their own careers and gained a better perspective on what I want to do within healthcare.

This class is a wonderful experience. I am so glad I decided to take it to make sure that I attended all of the sessions. The learnings from this course will stick with me throughout my professional career.
Great caliber of speakers speaking about a diverse array of healthcare topics.
Strengths: includes speakers from many backgrounds and ideologies. Excellent opportunity that could only be recreated by having over a dozen shadowing experiences or internships.
The speakers were fantastic, and the overall format was great. Maybe if the food was less healthy and a little more filling I would have enjoyed it more.

This course is possibly the highlight of my past year in the HCM program. The speakers are so inspirational and offer great insight on different careers that could be pursued in healthcare. It is a different experience to see examples of people who started out just like us and got to the positions they are in today. The advice that they give could not be found anywhere else! This course has been very valuable to me and I would encourage anyone to take it.

I really loved colloquium. I think the attendance practices were a little ridiculous. Some people were told they could write papers if they missed too many session while others were told they had to repeat the course.
Great course. It would be good to switch up the food sometimes.
Great seminar to hear from industry leaders!
It is a great experience to attend this class. I will never regret to take this one.
I'm glad we had more women towards the end. I appreciate non-clinician leaders in healthcare.
It was a great class
Course is good, learned a lot about healthcare leadership. Would like to learn more from non-white males in regards to leading healthcare organizations.
Great variety of speakers

I really appreciated the diversity of speakers, although a few more women could have helped. I especially enjoyed hearing from the policy focused speakers, it was great to learn more about how they combined management and policy in their work.
Useful!
You have to take this, but it doesn't feel like a class. It's a lot of fun and extremely rewarding to hear real people make a difference in the field

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie is awesome. He's the heart of this program and the reason I chose Yale.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  He is the reason so many impressive speakers want to come speak to the class. He is also careful to make sure that each student gets the chance to ask questions.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Wonderful instructor! Great introductions of speakers at beginning of the colloquiums!

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Dr. Forman is the most dedicated faculty member I have come into contact with. He will undoubtedly be someone I continue to reach out to for mentorship and advice as I move forward in my career.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Dr. Forman has built a great network of speakers to bring into class and prepared them well on how to make their hour with us each week effective. Better communication about he final paper would be appreciated - there was a lot of confusion about a paper that is required of everyone versus the papers that are required if you have too many absences.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie does not have weaknesses.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Great moderator, fantastic at making the speakers really tell the class things they needed to hear.

Instructor: Howard P Forman  Strengths: - Very knowledgable in all aspects of healthcare - Very open to engage in any discussions that the class brings up - Explains topics very clearly and precisely - Very available to help any student who needs it - Explains assignments and deliverables very well. - Great sense of humor! Weaknesses: - NONE!
Instructor: Howard P Forman  So great in terms of giving opportunities for students to connect with folks from different backgrounds.
Instructor: Howard P Forman  How does he have so many connections?
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie, you da best. Excited for Zeke
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Brought great speakers
Instructor: Howard P Forman  good
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Very helpful, insightful
Instructor: Howard P Forman  Howie brings in great speakers

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Valuable and productive experience with fairly low commitment
I recommend this to anyone, I learned a lot.

You hear about the life and career experiences of different health care leaders. You hear how they got to where they are today and hopefully will learn how you can achieve what you want in your career.
Firsthand lectures from industry professionals with up to date perspective on important topics in healthcare management.
If you can get in the course, take it!
The speakers in this course are truly amazing and we had access to some fantastic people. Definitely take this course if you want access to top healthcare leaders.

This course is possibly the highlight of my past year in the HCM program. The speakers are so inspirational and offer great insight on different careers that could be pursued in healthcare. It is a different experience to see examples of people who started out just like us and got to the positions they are in today. The advice that they give could not be found anywhere else! This course has been very valuable to me and I would encourage anyone to take it.
Great opportunity to hear from leaders in US healthcare, but not much discussion of international health issues.
great insights and cool people
You learn a lot about leadership and the different paths different leaders have taken to be successfull
interestng speaker series
Fantastic course to learn from a diverse set of leaders in the field of healthcare
Enjoy!
Great! You might create for yourself a mentor along the way
